item.title: This old fencing has been left fly tipped on the public Green space, 19th October
item.description:
The corner house has renewed their fencing up to a point and flt tipped the old fencing on this public Green space. It has been reported before but to no effect. The bulk is towards Horncastle Road but there is some by the Westhorne Avenue grass area adjacent to the new fence. This does the grass no good at all and means the old wood is not recycled but fly tipped for somebody else to remove. Please take enforcement action to remove and allow the grass area to recover.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Horncastle Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned/stolen and damaged bicycles left in communal walkways and stair access areas of the building, 19th October
item.description:
Several abandoned or possibly stolen bicycles have been left throughout the buildingâ€™s communal areas for weeks. There are 3 on lvl 5 and at least 1 on ground floor. All are in poor condition, unlocked, and unused. They obstruct the walkways.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Well Street, Hackney, London

item.title: Multiple Potholes - near bus stop F Heath Road (On A207 Crayford Road), 19th October
item.description:
Multiple Potholes - near bus stop F Heath Road (On A207 Crayford Road). In addition, multiple cracks crossing road surface. When riding a bicycle, these must be swerved round leading the bike into traffic. Problems are not solely at the bus stop, they are before (towards railway overbridge) and afterwards (until roundabout with Princes Road)
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crayford Road, Barnes Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 5 lime bikes on motorcycle only parking space, 19th October
item.description:
Following my earlier report, 5 of your bikes are no occupying a parking space clearly marked and reserved for motorcycles. There is no space left for motorcycles and the motorbike currently parked is at risk of being damaged if your bikes get knocked over.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Leander Road, Brixton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lack of give way signage causing traffic problems and road rage regularly., 19th October
item.description:
There is a traffic slowing narrow barrier that has a priority sign for the northbound cars. On the side for southbound cars, there are road markings indicating to give way but no other signage, making it unclear who had priority. This causes regular incidents at the spot, horns beeping regularly, and confusion for drivers. Just recently the police were called due to a physical fight following road rage between 2 drivers at this spot! Again today I have seen 2 cars drive through on different occasions where they should have given way to the oncoming car with priority but did not. This is an accident waiting to happen. I suggest that more clear signage is put up for the southbound travelling vehicles to make this a safer spot.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cold Blow Lane, New Cross Gate, London
Report on FixMyStreet
